content: errata smallest size had an incorrect cast on amount updated pdf and sent out updates all should be good danish version found here https //strikkeglad dk/53078/giv-mig-striber/ i designed this hat for my 3rd design in coordination with warm the line this hat is knit in the round from the bottom up the stripes are knit with a fun texture between each color i designed this hat to use up those extra little bits of worsted weight yarn you might have in your stash it is a great way to help warm the line this voting season i knit the samples in both a non-superwash yarn and in superwash to show the difference in the yarns also when charity knitting it can be best to knit in washable yarn the non-superwash version was knit in size 3 with blue sky fibers woodstock worsted 37g of driftwood for mc cc1 used 5 5g rusted roof cc2 used 5 5g thermal spring cc3 used 5 5g midnight sea the superwash version was knit in size 4 with cascade yarns 220 superwash 47g jet for mc cc colors used knit picks cc1 used 7g copper in swish cc2 used 7g pinecone heather in swish cc3 used 7g brass heather in wool of the andes superwash sizes 1 2 3 4 5 6 finished measurements around body of hat 16 4 17 7 18 9 20 2 21 5 22 7 /41 7 45 48 51 3 54 6 57 7 cm you generally want to have a hat with 1-2 /2 5-5cm of negative ease so knit a size 1-2 smaller than your actual head size
